intro: Centaurea moritziana, commonly known as Moritz's knapweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright, branched stems covered in fine hairs. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered with dense pubescence, while the flowers are usually pink to purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky areas.
